Donuts are baked fresh everyday.. my personal faves are the cake crumb donuts and the French twist (I think that's what they're called) donuts. So light and fluffy and delicious. Jelly donuts are a little heavy, but delicious nonetheless. I highly recommend this place!
author: Rhea K.

description: Great customer service!! Awesome donuts and spent less than $4.
author: J C.

description: A coworker brought in donuts from here this morning and I went to town on those donut holes like Tony Montana on a pile of cocaine.  Crazy delicious!
author: Monica R.

description: Swung by on National Donut Day and they were almost sold out! Still had a pile of fresh plain glazed donut holes though. These are my favorite anyway -- fluffy, perfectly browned, not over glazed. I left happy with extras for my coworkers. You're not going to find nicer folks to get your sugar fix from. Stop in!
author: Kiely H.

description: Great old-fashioned donuts and a generous staff! Walked in late in the afternoon and got more free donuts than I even ordered, all of which were fresh and delicious.
author: Drew P.

description: Love that place! Not only are the donuts great, but they also have amazing Muffins. Service is awesome. No matter how much you buy, they'll also give you a couple of donut holes for free!
author: Moritz S.

description: I was just stumbled home after a concert and walked into The Jelly Donut at midnight with, no joke, two dollars in my pocket. I picked out two cheap items and was given a jelly and a cinnamon roll for free. Amazing service and the donut were great.
author: Nick G.

description: Great donuts, friendly service, fast line and did I say great donuts?
author: Jm C.

description: Good apple fritter but the glaze and maple bars were inedible.  The lady serving the donuts was nice.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Yeah, I'm from Canada. Donuts are part of my culture.

Avoid this one. Walk over to Philz or Dynamo to get your donut.

It's not that far. Really.
author: Ima D.

description: The donuts are very good. I only order jelly donuts but the reason I can evaluate the other types is that THEY ALWAYS GIVE ME FREE DONUTS OR DONUT HOLES. The owners are very low key but very nice.
author: John S.

description:
The Healthy Yelper is far from a donut connoisseur, but when he's been out dancing the night before and wants a little side with his breakfast, he sometimes indulges. At least a bite or two.

This morning those (two) bites were of a very good cinnamon crusted concoction from this Mission purveyor of all things donut. Less than a buck and I had my fix, and the friendly guy tossed in an extra at no charge. Having had my two bite limit, someone in need benefited from their generosity. Jelly Donut goodness all around.
author: Jason B.

description:
The Jelly Donut holds a very dear place in my heart. I am pretty sure that, for the price, they are the best donuts in the City. I'm not 100% sure that they're the best donuts EVER, but I do think they have possibly the best SERVICE for a donut shop ever. I am so happy to have them near my house!

They always give you a free donut. Even if you only buy one donut. And they really seem to care about their customers and making people happy. One time my partner and I were walking by there at like 1am, and they were in there baking the next morning's donuts, and it smelled SO GOOD that we just stood at the window and watched for a while. One of them saw us out there and let us in to buy some fresh donuts!

The thing these folks are really, really strong on are the cake donuts (the kind that come with sprinkles, coconut, etc. on them). I don't normally even like cake-style donuts but theirs are AMAZING. Normally, I'm a big fan of cruellers, but theirs aren't so great. Average. Same with the twists and bars. Good, but not great. The other thing I can really highly recommend are the apple fritters. Really awesome.
author: Lynae Z.

description:
Thanks to the Jelly Donut, I'm going to have to start walking on 23rd St. to get from my new home to BART in the morning.

Because that smell of donuts - that thick, fresh, incredibly sweet, absolutely irresistible aroma - wafts down 24th St. and infiltrates my nostrils a full block before I even see the store sign, right as I'm headed to catch my daily train. 

I can't help it; I immediately start thinking, "Gee, this coffee I'm carrying in my travel mug will taste EVEN BETTER if I pair it with a delicious, fresh donut. And it will be a CHEAP breakfast, because the Jelly Donut charges 75 cents for a donut and then throws in, like, six donut holes - FOR FREE - and I just took a pay cut because the company I work for is facing a $145 million budget gap. Wow, this is an idea that is both practical AND delicious! One donut with sprinkles, please, super friendly man behind the counter at this beloved Jelly Donut! Have a great day!"

I can predict it: within a week, I won't be able to fit into any of my clothes. Tomorrow, the route changes. You heard it here first.
author: Anna G.

description:
Everything you heard is true..and then some.
I walked in here after reading the reviews on here. 
I had my eye on a glazed and an old fashioned.
I left with not only those, but three extra and a small milk.
All of this donuty goodness was 3.25. 
I didn't even realize I had two extra until I ate one, looked into my bag to see the rest of the damage I was going to cause to my waistline, and saw the 4 I had left waiting for me. 
AMAZING. 
I think I've found donut heaven. 
Minus one star for being cash only.
author: Cecilia R.

description: Jelly Donut is a special place.  The donuts aren't really anything special.  They're more Crispy Creme than Dynamo.  However, they are cheap, served by friendly ladies, and it seems that for every 1 you buy you get 2 free.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Popeye + spinach, me + apple fritter.  This is a place for a proper double-fister, candy coated, crackly-skin, chewy-dense, all-day fritter.  Eat one and forget the other meals of the day.  

Not just cheapcheapcheap but they will throw a free bonus surprise donut in your bag too.

Sometimes I bike past their little corner storefront at night, without a wish for donuts, until I see rows of tempting coffee pots wafting steam that beckons me in.  Just a couple of seats and nobody around.  It's an Ed Hopper painting.  

Neighborhoody.  Recommended.
author: Pat L.

description:
JELLY DONUT IS NOW UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT... Super disappointed, but I decided to stop in anyway. I got my usual; an old fashioned maple and a chocolate donut. Also had my mom tagged along with me and she got a regular sugar donut. The new management totally switched up how the donuts tasted. Maple didn't even taste like the slightest bit if maple was in it, the coating looked like an eggshells color but slightly more khaki. As for the sugar donut it was mediocre. The lady also over charged. Handed over a 10 and she have back 2$ and some change and said she only received a 5$ bill from us. TOTAL RIP OFF. Who in their right mind would willingly pay 7$ something for 3 average plane-jane donuts. Definitely will not be back. I miss the old management. They were way more friendly and actually gave the correct change :(
Bottom line, no wouldn't recommend it to a friend, make sure you have proper change. I'd probably skip this place and head to another donut shop a couple blocks away if I have to.
author: Michelle C.

description: This business is featured on Scoutmob for 50% purchases up to 7.00 off but guess what... They don't honor it. Just for that and the horrible communication with the lady that works there this place gets 1 star. It's best to avoid this sh*thole of a donut shop. I'm going to contact Scoutmob and make them aware of this BS. Hopefully they take their featured info off Scoutmob so they don't get anymore free publicity.
author: Nathaniel S.

description: Incredible! Friendly staff, delicious doughnuts & coffee and for such amazing prices. Love this adorable spot & wish I lived closer.
author: Rachel O.

description: I literally go all the way to the Mission just to buy donuts from here! Donuts are donuts, and the quality of them is definitely up to par, but it's not even about that. The family that runs it are so nice, and giving! I once only had 4 dollars which was enough to buy a half dozen, so I did. I turned around for a second and when I went back, the lady had put like 15 donuts in the bag! They're awesome. One of the best donut stops in the city.
author: Eve F.

description: Love getting my morning coffee and donuts here on my way from Bart to work!!! Staff are super sweet, warm, and surprises you with donutholes!! Yay for mom-and-pop-shops! Keep up the great work!
author: Jenny T.

description: fresh donuts even at 830PM!!! she gave me free ones. i'll be back!!
author: Siva M.

description: The donuts are fine, but nothing standout.  The coffee is not that great.  However the prices are reasonable, the service is friendly, and they often throw lots of stuff on top of your order for free -- donut holes, extra donuts if you order a few of them, etc.  Seems like a smart business practice -- people love this!  Although I think I'd trade the free stuff for a bit more deliciousness.
author: David C.

description: I love it here.  The staffs are so nice!  The donuts are superb and the prices great too.  Every single visit had been great (not one are bad), and  I am going to continue to go back.  I have to say it again; the staffs are awesome!
author: Mei L.

description:
NO NO NO! I will not get a donut today.  That's what I used to have to say every day I used to pass this glorious place on my way to the bart station.  They have some real good donuts.  And it's way better than all the panaderia's in the hood.
Plus they always fill your bag to the brim with donut holes, like I need more sugar and lard added to my ass.  Anyway they are lovely and once I was coughing and they gave a me a free drink.  I love them so.  
It's also a great place to go late at night to get something free soft/ and sweet to though at your enemy on bikes.  Long story.
author: amanda v.

description:
It's the Jelly Donut! 

Every time I walk past here on my way to or from BART, I think of the rapper Jelly Donut. (http://illbilly.com/Videos/Jelly_D/Jelly_D.mov.) He should be their mascot. Not like they need any more business, though. There are like 40 people crammed in here most mornings. Total scene. I prefer to go during off-peak hours, after 6pm, when the Asian lady slips an extra donut into the white paper bag, and we both act like it was an accident. It's pretty sweet. I'm trying to work it so I can start requesting what my free donut's gonna be. I always get a little crestfallen when she drops in a glazed donut. I hate glazed.

The crispy old-fashioned ones are tops. I can't think of a better way to spend sixty cents. I almost took off a star for the slight heaviness in my stomach after I eat here, but then it wouldn't be a donut without some grease would it now?
author: Katrina D.

description:
As if there weren't enough panaderias around to tempt me, I can also add Jelly Donuts to the list of places that contribute to my artery's well-being. 
I have sampled nearly most of the donuts, the selection is basic, original glaze, apple fritters the size of frisbees, chocolate glazed, of course jelly donuts. But my favorite is the maple glazed coconut donut. Only complaint is that by 9pm the donuts are limited to whatever is left over from the day. So if you want chocolate and they are out, then you are out of luck.

My favorite thing about this donut shop is the $1 I pay for a medium macadamia nut roasted coffee. I know, it's probably not the best coffee in the world, but sometimes I just want caffeine regardless of taste, or quality. Sometimes I just want to desecrate on the whole ritual of drinking coffee by sweetening that sucker up with cream and sugar. I'm weird like that. For $1, the coffee is a lot better than I expected, and even when I just order  a donut I always find 3-4 free donut holes (or is it circles?) in my bag. It's like finding little gifts, I love that.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: If you're in the mood and looking for a solid place, this is a good spot. We ordered a chocolate glazed cake and old-fashioned. Both were fresh tasting and really good. Extra point for adding a cruller in the bag for free. I'm not judging that one because I'm generally not a fan. Yes, the only donut that I don't care for...
author: Eme L.

description:
You often wonder if they charge higher prices so that the free donut seems like a good deal.

But I don't care. Delicious donuts, yay for free ones, and yay for affordability.
author: Mark A.

description:
What is better than FREE FOOD?!  
The answer is: nothing.

I orderd one regular and one old fashioned donut, which came to a total of $1.20.  Then she's like I'll give you another one of these for free, and threw in another of the regular donuts.  

Hell yes I'll eat more free donut!
author: Levi B.

description:
The donuts are average.  Similar to other places in the area.

But the staff are super nice and give you free donuts!!!
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description:
So this is gonna be harsher than most peeps reviews I am sure. I know my donuts, I mean REALLY REALLY know my donuts. I've been study this dying cuisine for many years now being a pre-diabetic and all (it makes sense to me).

Anyhoo I am sadly giving them 3 stars. I hate doing this, because small donut shops are also dying and I want to support them. I really do. Also remember my little yelpers, Krispy Kreme sucks butt (it's the fast food version of a donut).

So this is all I am going to post. I don't want to hurt their business anymore than I have. You probably will like their donuts, they are better than Krispy Kreme. Only donut snobs should stay clear. Please stop by, give them your business, and eat donuts. Support your local San Francisco donut shops. They need it. 

Viva la donut!
author: Ali K.

description:
I guess I can call off that whole "Is it just me that gets the free donuts? Or maybe you, too, since you're always in there with me?"

The only thing that makes me sad about The Donut Place (like I ever have called it anything else) is that it always seems like one of the regulars is leaving her two little dogs tied to the meter out front. At least they wear sweaters.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Have stopped by this place a few times and always experience the following:

1) (Vietnamese?) lady behind the counter always smiling, even if distracted with a telephone call or other customers,
2) Donuts that are definitely above par (standard types of donuts, but always taste fresh), and
3) She always hooks it up with a couple extra donuts!  How can you not dig that?
author: Dareyn S.

description:
Love this joint--reminds me of little donut shacks in Southern California or maybe Dunkin Donuts in Boston, though I'll take this place's donuts and coffee (though DD coffee has sentimental value).

Their donuts are the real deal, though I don't eat a lot of donuts--just fresh, sugary, caloric.

Coffee's good too.
author: Luke J.

description:
DUNKIN' DONUTS! DUNKIN' DONUTS! DUNKIN' DONUTS!

OK, I just said that to get your attention. I'm from Boston--and if you are too, then you know what I'm talkin' about. Good coffee and well--doughnuts. Starbucks? Fahgettaboutit.

I am declaring "The Jelly Donut" the best coffeshop in San Francisco. Not cafe. Coffeeshop. In that old timey way--where you kick it with all the other old folks.

AND...

As mentioned in other reviews, when you buy a doughnut/doughnuts, they hook you up with either extra doughnut holes and/or doughnuts.

Today I went there and got 2 doughnuts, a medium coffee (visitors please note: med = sm in SF), and a Schnapple for $4.

THAT IS A DEAL!

The Jelly Donut = Best Coffee/Donut Shop in SF.
author: Gabriel J.

description: A donut lovers dream! Not the creative stuff you'd get at Dynamo (for $3 a piece) just your good old fashioned fluffy donuts. It's amazing! I get half a dozen donut holes for $0.50! As if that wasn't already a great deal, the employees are kind enough to add another 3 or so for free, that's 9 donuts holes for $0.50! Sometimes I'll even grab a cup of joe, and some regular sized donuts for less than 5 bucks, and I always walk out with an extra (complimentary) bag donuts to take home for later......broke and have a sweet tooth? THIS IS YOUR SPOT! = )
author: Irene N.

description:
Donuts high quality.  I think I may prefer these to Bob's.

They also gave me a free donut (sugar).  I paid for a glazed and a chocolate.  Both were tasty.  Fresh.

I love the surprise of the free donut.  I feel like I won a prize.  If you play your cards right, you too may find a bonus in your bag.  It's like looking for the prize in the box of crackerjacks.
author: Aaron T.

description:
FREE STUFF!!! 

Its so nice. I usually buy 2 doughnuts and theres usually a free doughnut or doughnut holes in the bag. Its really a gesture that has me coming back all the time. My doughnuts always taste good but the free ones taste better because they are free! 

Its also nice to go here because its a little local place. Go and buy some doughnuts and see what ya get!
author: Audra H.

description: You buy one finger-licking donut pay 75cents take your bag look inside and see 3-7 donuts ... How can you not love it ... :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
Glazed buttermilk bar temptress!  Whore of the donut world.  You temp me with free donut holes and your kind Thai dealers.  

Better than the San Francisco chain donut stores, the jelly donut is what a donut shop should be.  Open too late for the good of society,  you should try the Jelly Donut.  Get a glazed buttermilk bar and join the day laborers drinking big Styrofoam cups of coffee with too much sugar.  

With this much sugar you'll be ready for your breakdown.
author: Anthony K.

description: Great inexpensive donuts, really friendly staff, seemingly always open.  Fantastic apple fritters.  Also, free extra donuts seem to be the norm.  Once you're over the novelty of having bacon on your donut, stop by Jelly.
author: Chris P.

description:
6am, on my way to work.

Used Scout mob coupon and was overcharged.  When I questioned the man, he brought down the price by $1.00 but no reciept and he mumbled something about taxes. Still overcharged by a couple of $

Donuts not spectacular.

Sorry grumpy jelly donut man, I'm not going back.

***If you have a car, there is a delicious donut shop on the corner of 24th and Noe- its where the police hang out and the donuts are better and cheaper.
author: Brenda B.

description: Cheap, delcious... and they give you free donuts with your donuts! Also not far off the beaten path. Not fancy gourmet or anything, just delicious.
author: Leah M.

description:
Ok, so I'm a pretty healthy dude...i ride my bike a lot, I watch what I eat, but I do have weakness: primarly booze, sweets and cheese.

On this particular day I was pretty hungover and headed over to Philz Coffee. As I passed by the Jelly Donut I thought to myself, "oh what the hell!" So I popped in and got a glazed twist. The guy was cool and threw in a glazed donut as well. 

I anxiously pulled out the twist and bit into it...ehhh. Not too impressed. It was not super fluffy, it was a bit more dense than I prefer. Same goes for the glazed donut. 

However, I'm a sucker for warm donuts, so I will be back to find out when I can get a warm one.
author: isaias J.

description: The other day I tried an old donut shop in my former hood and boy has that place gone downhill :(  Fortunately, I found a great place in my current hood thanks to yelp.  What everyone said was true, its small, the donuts are great and they will toss in an extra donut or donut hole for ya!  But what some fail to mention is the size of their donuts compared to other places, not only are they great but they are big.  We all know that size doesn't matter but when it comes to donuts I beg to differ.  So to summarize: next time you feel like a good old fashioned donut give Jelly Donut a try and I promise you wont be sad.
author: Mick H.

description: These guys are the greatest.  When I was working downtown at some slave architecture internship I was broke as a joke and often couldn't afford breakfast until I found these guys. I would buy a donut in the morning just to get the calories to make it through the day and the guy behind the counter would always say hello, smile and slip in at least another donut.  Working 60 hours a week to pay your rent and student loans makes you appreciate a great deal and service.
author: Atom H.

description:
I got two cake donuts, a long chocolate twist and a handful of free donut holes for about $2.30. 

The cake donuts are quite different from the cake donuts I know and love, but they were good in their own way...VERY sugary on the outside and VERY doughy on the inside. 

The donut holes were...decent. Tasted kinda bland....but, heck, a donut is a donut, right? That's what I wanted....and that's what I got!
author: Danyell K.

description: Great donuts, the selection is simple yet wide, and they stay fresh and tasty for hours after you bought them. The cashiers are always nice, and the 4 times I went there, they gave me free donuts.
author: R B.

description: This place may not look it's best but they are really cheap and taste really good. Good deals to get donuts and worth going to if craving for donuts!!!
author: C G.

description: Pretty good donut place. Nice variety and good prices. Good location near BART.  Recommended.
author: Chad H.

description: best donuts in the city.  only thing they don't they don't have are my beloved Blueberry donuts that i can only find at ferrell's in santa cruz.  super nice people.
author: eric i.

description: Finding this place was terrible for me. The donuts are delicious and the service is amazing, silly as it sounds to say that about a place you go to and get donuts... but it's true. The smiling catches and I always leave with a grin and too many delicious donuts.
author: Ricky B.

description: Extra star for the bonus donut -- I guess it's a regular thing here!  I think the crumbcakes I had here were a bit underdone, though (maybe they churn out more than they keep under quality control -- must have to make a lot to give so many away!).  Still have to stick with Donut World on 9th Ave.
author: Ari M.

description: Found some extra donut balls with my purchase of 1 $1 Jelly Donut. Thanks donut lady!
author: Jack K.

description: The other donuts are good, but don't get the donut holes.  They were not good..  They were very doughy and tasted they were not completely cooked.  They are smaller so they should cook quicker.  I will stick to the glazed / chocolate covered old fashions.
author: Po L.

description: That was a totally respectable couple of donuts I just had from here.  Freshly made and solidly tasty.  Nom nom nom.
author: Jess L.

description: Mmmmm....donuts... (in Homer Simpson fashion)  The fact that this place is around the corner from my house makes me love it, but after having their donuts on two separate occasions and being floored at their tastiness, I now can say that I love The Jelly Donut unconditionally.  Both times, the person working has given us a special little treat in our bag to find when we get home (read - getting HOOKED UP).  So far I've tried - old fashioned chocolate, chocolate covered custard-filled, cinnamon crumble, glazed buttermilk bar, apple fritter, glazed donut holes, and of course, the obligatory glazed jelly donut.  Looking back at this list, you might be judging me right now - but don't.  Give this place a try and you'll see just how wonderful it is, and you won't blame me for my lengthy list of favorites.  I've never been disappointed with anything I've tried.  One tip - it's cash only, but there is an ATM onsite.  Jelly Donut, you have earned a loyal customer in me!
author: Jenna C.

description: After leaving the disappointing Dynamo Donuts which had no donuts, we continued our donut tour by stopping in at Jelly Donuts. We had read the Yelp reviews, and very quickly we understood the flavor from the bad reviews. There were 3 people behind the counter, 2 of them smiling at us. The smiling ones were just there for companionship of the grumpy one, that was in charge of getting us our donuts. I asked for the maple/cream filled. It took 3 tries even with me pointing to receive the kind I wanted, then she gave me a random free donut. The place was run down and grimy. After Starman got his donut (the smiling ones cajoled grimly into giving him a free donut), we got out of there quickly, and ate our trial donuts on the street. They weren't very good or special. I tucked my free one away in my coat pocket. We felt tired and greased out on just one, and so didn't visit any other donut shops. National Donut day was over early. Later that night, when I was very hungry after aikido practice and waiting for the bus, I found my free donut and ate it. At that moment, it was delicious. But I won't ever go back for more at the Jelly Donut.
author: Herschell L.

description:
This place is as sweet as it gets.
I have been coming here as far back as I can remember. The doughnuts are top notch-no artificial aftertaste, fresh and just sugary enough to get those taste buds watering.
The best part is the woman working the register always slips me an extra one! I have gotten at least $20 in free doughnuts by now.
author: Hayley S.

description: I love donuts.  I also love Cambodian pop music. The Jelly Donut has both.  :)
author: Bigfrog W.

description: So, the donuts are good and you even get a free surprise.  But  what puts the place off the charts are the people who own and operate Jelly donut.  Wonderful, cheerful, welcoming and always there what an experience
author: George L.

description: I love the jelly doughnut.  True the coffee sucks and the doughnuts honestly are just so-so but it has that neighborhood vibe and the couple behind the counter just couldn't be nicer.  Lovely, lovely people.  I really enjoy going there.  Also: cheap, and you always find a freebie in your bag when you leave.
author: David B.

description: Chocolate croissant, apple fritter, hazelnut coffee and a ton of free donut holes make my morning, almost every morning. I love you, Jelly Donut.
author: Britney K.

description:
Are you guys kidding me? I was craving donuts soo bad at work and I looked this place up. Right when I got there I was put off by the straggly looking customers and the over all cleanliness of the place, but I was already there so whatever, I ordered some donuts. 1 glazed, one chocolate and an apple fritter thing.  Like everyone else said I got some freebies. 

Get in my car, and start eating..."Uhgggg." Something not so soft and chewy. NEVER GOING BACK. 

Im starting to give up on yelp. There are better places in the east bay. Like World's Fair Donuts. 

Im done with donuts for a while. Horrified. Should have trust my better judgement.
author: Cindy D.

description: Best donuts around, plus they'll give you free donuts every time you stop by.  Try to beat that.  My friend (50-Tooth Slim) has a theory that the donut lady carefully measures her customers and tries to match the free donuts to each personality.  So check out those free donuts: what do they say about you?
author: Aram D.

description: donuts are perfectly fine, but bonus points for the super-friendly staff and free donut holes!
author: Mike E.
